poem:
**Calories in Colloquy**

Under the rainbow glow of screens,  
sugar whispers in pixels, bread dreams  
of its own kind. Young eyes wide,  
feed on staged delights, sweet-tongued,  
grease-laced promises laid between  
the thin haze of adverts.  
Five minutes is all  
it takes to tip the scale of day,  
a lullaby of empty crumbs  
and amplified cravings.
